newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea '97 state procurement set at 4.05 trln won.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea '97 state procurement set at 4.05 trln won.

text.p: South Korea's Office of Supply said on Monday its procurement plans for 1997 were set at 4.05 trillion won, up from an estimated four trillion won in 1996.
The office said in a statement the number of procurement items would be 320, including ready-mixed cement, steel bars and transportation equipment.
It said of the total, 62 items worth 793 billion won would be bought through international bidding.
Foreign participation in bidding has been allowed since the start of 1997. ($1 = 847 won)
